chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick B Tompkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Patrick B Tompkins was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patrick B Tompkins is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Patrick B Tompkins was found guilty of Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).
  • Patrick B Tompkins was found guilty of Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Patrick B Tompkins was found guilty of Represent Another's License as Own, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.43(1)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs and DNA  to be paid within 6 months after his release.

Court grants 92 days credit. Attorney to file a letter within 7 days if the defendant is entitled to more credit.
Consecutive to:
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

Defendant Patrick B Tompkins in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy T. Kay.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing as to counts 1, 5 and 6. Court imposed the following sentence:

Ct. 1 - 9 months jail consecutive
            Court costs $268.00
            DNA Surcharge $250.00 and must provide the DNA sample if not already provided

Ct. 5 -  30 days jail consecutive, Court costs of $243.00

Ct. 6 - 30 days jail consecutive, Court costs of $243.00

92 days credit.  Attorney to file letter to the court within 7 days if he believe's the defendant is entitled to more credit. 

Defendant to pay the court costs within 6 months after his release or turn into a civil judgement.

Defendant Patrick B Tompkins in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy T. Kay.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called @ 08:42 am for Jury Trial. Attorney Kay presents arguments on his Motion in Limine. State presents arguments. Court denied 1 and 3 of the Motion. Parties will stipulate to part 2 of the Motion. Jurors enter the courtroom @ 09:23 am. Court introduces the staff and provides instructions the jurors. Clerk gives oath to jurors on voir dire. Court asks questions of the jurors. Side Bar.  Juror Eric J. excused at 09:56 am. State asks questions of the jurors. Defense counsel asks questions of the jurors. Side Bar. Parties each have 5 strikes. Jurors are selected @ 10:20 am and clerk swears in the jurors. Court takes recess @ 10:22 am. Court reconved @ 10:37 am and jurors enter the courtroom. State presents opening statements. Defense presents opening statements. Officer Nicholas Hendriksen from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the state. Cross examination by the defense. Court takes takes recess @ 12:02 pm. Court reconved @ 12:49 pm. Defense continues with his cross with officer Hendriksen. Redirect by the state and the defense. Officer Richard Helm from the city of New Berlin was sworn and testified on behalf of the state. Cross examination by the defense.  Laura Hedden from the Wisconsin Crime Lab was sworn and testified on behalf of the
state. Specialist David Platta from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the state. Cross examination by the defense. Specialist Brandon Ernst from the City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the state.  Cross examination by the defense. Court excuses the jurors from the courtroom @ 2:35 pm. Before the break, defendant stated that he wishes to testify now. Court reconved @ 2:48 pm. State rests.   Patrick Tompkins was sworn and testified on his own behalf. Cross examination by the state. Redirect by the defense. Defense rests. Exhibits are received.  Court excuses the jurors from the courtroom @ 3:34 pm. State is requesting the court to reopen the testimony and adjourn the matter until tomorrow for a rebuttal witness to testify. Court denied the request.  Court reconved @ 4:33 pm and court instructs the jurors. State presents closing arguments. Court further instructs the jurors and clerk swears in the bailiff. Jurors start deliberate @ 5:41 pm. 7:56, case called on the record as the jurors have a question. Judge responds to the question with the approval of the attorney's and question is returned to the jurors.   Exhibit #11 will be withdrawn and given back to the state to be returned to the City of Waukesha PD.  Jury have reached a verdict and rendered a verdict @ 08:32.  Court reconved @ 08:58 pm. Court reads the verdict. Jurors find the defendant guilty on count 1, count 2 not-guilty, count 3 - not guilty, count 4 - not guilty, count 5 - guilty, count 6 - guillty. Court polls all the jurors. Parties ask for judgement on the verdicts as to counts 1, 5 and 6. Court grants the request. Defense counsel is requesting bail be modified. State is requesting that bail be revoked. Court revokes the bail.   Parties are requesting the PSI be done within  30 days.
filed by Attorney Kay

Defendant Patrick B Tompkins in court, in custody, with attorney Timothy T. Kay.   Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is ready for trial. Defense is ready for trial.

Court grants motion in limine.

Court will not address bail without a bail motion being filed. 
State advised court that they have 5 witnesses and may be a 1 1/2 day trial. State requests alternate juror. Court will have an alternate juror. 
Court advised parties that if they file jury instructions they are to be filed by close of business on April 8, 2016.

Defendant Patrick B Tompkins in court, in custody (OTP'd from Fox Lake Correctional Institution), with attorney Timothy T. Kay.
Motion filed by the Defense - To Suppress.

Witnesses sworn and testified.

Court deems testimony closed.
State presented closing arguments.

Court finds/orders the following:  Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds the Officers had probable cause to conduct the search.
Court also finds a warrant was not necessary.
Therefore, Court denies the Defense Motion to Suppress.
Court signs order denying.
All parties received a copy of the order in court.

Defense believes the defendant will be discharged from Fox Lake on 04/01/016.
